section.title: Modeling the Animal Premises
section.para: Computers can be thought of as mechanisms or containers for modeling aspects of the real world. The Tracker software application models the animals and event histories associated with a livestock animal premises. The Tracker application uses a document paradigm to model an animal premises.

section.title: Tracker Model Documents
section.para: Whether it is word processing documents, spreadsheet documents, or presentation documents, today's computer users are most familiar with a type of software application that create and manipulate a document files to describe specific instances of information.

The Tracker enables users to create, transform and edit tracker model documents that represent specific Animal Premises. Model documents are displayed and manipulated with the various Tracker Editors, Wizards, and utilities. The attributes of the premises, the animals in the premises and the events associated with animals are specified within these model documents.
Tracker Model document files utilize a .tracker file extension to distinguish them from other types of files.

section.title: Tracker Data Model
section.para: In the Tracker all activity centers around the manipulation of Tracker Model Documents. Understanding the structure of Tracker Model documents is the easiest way to learn to use the information management facilities of the Tracker.

All tracker model documents structurally conform to the Tracker Data Model. In the Tracker Data Model a single Premises contains zero or more animals. Each Animal must have at least one but may have more than one (identification) tags. Each Tag must have at least one but may have more than one associated events.
